name: LOLBins Abuse Detection
description: Hunt for suspicious use of living-off-the-land binaries (certutil, rundll32, regsvr32) commonly abused by adversaries
hypothesis: Attackers are using legitimate Windows binaries to evade detection while downloading payloads or executing malicious code
query: process_name in ("certutil.exe", "rundll32.exe", "regsvr32.exe") AND (command_line contains "download" OR command_line contains "http" OR command_line contains "/i:")

findings.description: Certutil.exe used to download suspicious file from external IP
Rundll32.exe executing JavaScript from command line

journal.content: Initiating hunt based on recent intel about APT groups using LOLBins
Refined query to reduce false positives from legitimate admin activity
High confidence finding: certutil downloading from suspicious IP
Medium confidence: rundll32 JS execution pattern
Identified 3 true positives out of 47 events. Created detection rule for certutil HTTP downloads.
Hunt completed. 2 new IOCs added to blocklist. Updated playbook with LOLBins detection guidance.

query_history.query: process_name in ("certutil.exe", "rundll32.exe", "regsvr32.exe") AND (command_line contains "download" OR command_line contains "http")
process_name in ("certutil.exe", "rundll32.exe", "regsvr32.exe") AND (command_line contains "download" OR command_line contains "http" OR command_line contains "/i:")

name: DNS Tunneling Detection
description: Identify potential DNS tunneling used for command and control or data exfiltration
hypothesis: Adversaries may be using DNS protocol to tunnel traffic and evade network security controls
query: dns_query_length > 50 AND dns_query_subdomain_count > 5 AND dns_response_type = "TXT" OR dns_query_entropy > 3.5

findings.description: High entropy DNS queries to suspicious domain with TXT record responses
Abnormal DNS query volume from single host

journal.content: Starting DNS tunneling hunt based on anomalous network traffic patterns
Critical finding: DNS tunneling to known malicious domain
Escalated to incident INC-008. Continuing hunt for additional affected hosts.
Additional host showing similar DNS patterns
Working with network team to implement DNS filtering rules. Hunt ongoing.

query_history.reason: Initial query for long DNS queries

query_history.query: dns_query_length > 50 AND dns_query_subdomain_count > 5 AND dns_response_type = "TXT" OR dns_query_entropy > 3.5
query_history.reason: Added entropy and TXT record checks

name: Kerberoasting Detection
description: Hunt for Kerberos TGS-REP ticket requests indicating potential Kerberoasting attacks
hypothesis: Attackers with valid credentials are requesting service tickets for privileged accounts to crack offline
query: event_id = 4769 AND ticket_encryption_type = 0x17 AND service_name NOT IN ("krbtgt", "kadmin") AND requested_tickets > 10

findings.description: User account requesting service tickets for 15 different SPNs within 5 minutes
Service ticket requests using RC4 encryption from non-standard workstation

journal.content: Proactive hunt for Kerberoasting based on recent threat brief
Adjusted threshold and added encryption type filter
Critical: Detected likely Kerberoasting activity
Escalated to INC-012. Compromised account disabled. Forcing password reset for targeted SPNs.
Additional suspicious Kerberos activity from same subnet
Forensic analysis confirmed compromise. Updated detection rules.
Hunt completed. Created new alert rule for Kerberoasting. Updated IR playbook with Kerberos attack procedures.

query_history.query: event_id = 4769 AND ticket_encryption_type = 0x17 AND service_name NOT IN ("krbtgt", "kadmin")
event_id = 4769 AND ticket_encryption_type = 0x17 AND service_name NOT IN ("krbtgt", "kadmin") AND requested_tickets > 10

name: Data Exfiltration via Cloud Storage
description: Identify unusual data uploads to cloud storage services
hypothesis: Insider threat or compromised accounts uploading sensitive data to personal cloud storage
query: network_dst_domain matches "*.dropbox.com|*.box.com|*.mega.nz|drive.google.com" AND bytes_out > 100MB AND user NOT IN approved_cloud_users

findings.description: Employee uploaded 2.3GB to personal Dropbox account outside business hours
Large file transfer to MEGA.nz from accounting department
Bulk document uploads to Google Drive from developer workstation

journal.content: Hunt initiated following DLP alert review
Added approved user whitelist to reduce noise
Critical: Significant data upload to personal cloud storage
Escalated to INC-014. HR and legal notified. Account suspended pending investigation.
Additional exfiltration attempt via MEGA
Investigation revealed insider threat. Working with legal on response.
Developer upload was legitimate code backup - false positive
Hunt completed. Implemented enhanced DLP policies for cloud storage.

query_history.query: network_dst_domain matches "*.dropbox.com|*.box.com|*.mega.nz|drive.google.com" AND bytes_out > 100MB AND user NOT IN approved_cloud_users
query_history.reason: Added Google Drive and user whitelist

name: Persistence via Scheduled Tasks
description: Hunt for suspicious scheduled task creation for persistence
hypothesis: Adversaries establishing persistence through Windows scheduled tasks after initial compromise
query: event_id = 4698 AND (task_command contains "powershell" OR task_command contains "cmd.exe" OR task_command contains "wscript") AND task_run_as = "SYSTEM"

findings.description: Scheduled task created running obfuscated PowerShell as SYSTEM

journal.content: Proactive hunt for persistence mechanisms
Suspicious scheduled task with PowerShell execution
Task created after hours. PowerShell script is obfuscated. Escalating for forensics.
Hunt paused pending forensic analysis of discovered malware sample.

query_history.query: event_id = 4698 AND (task_command contains "powershell" OR task_command contains "cmd.exe" OR task_command contains "wscript") AND task_run_as = "SYSTEM"
query_history.reason: Expanded to other scripting engines and SYSTEM context

name: Cloud API Abuse
description: Detect anomalous AWS API calls indicating compromised credentials or insider threat
hypothesis: Compromised AWS credentials being used for reconnaissance or privilege escalation
query: cloud_provider = "AWS" AND (api_call in ("iam:GetPolicy", "iam:ListUsers", "iam:GetUser", "s3:GetBucketPolicy") OR error_code = "AccessDenied") AND api_calls_per_hour > 100

findings.description: Unusual IAM enumeration activity from unfamiliar IP address
Multiple AccessDenied errors suggesting privilege escalation attempts

journal.content: Investigating CloudTrail anomaly detected by UEBA
Critical: IAM enumeration from suspicious IP
Access key rotated. Session terminated. Reviewing CloudTrail logs for full scope.
Privilege escalation attempts detected prior to key rotation
Hunt ongoing. Building timeline of compromised key usage.

query_history.query: cloud_provider = "AWS" AND (api_call in ("iam:GetPolicy", "iam:ListUsers", "iam:GetUser", "s3:GetBucketPolicy") OR error_code = "AccessDenied") AND api_calls_per_hour > 100
query_history.reason: Added error monitoring and volume threshold
